# The Council Project Guidelines

## Project Context
This is a CLI tool for multi-model AI deliberation. The "Council" queries 5 frontier models in parallel (Claude, GPT, Grok, Llama, Perplexity), synthesizes their responses, and returns a unified answer through a "Personal Brain" interface.

## Code Style & Architecture
- Use TypeScript strict mode with ES modules
- Follow the Provider interface pattern for all LLM integrations
- All API calls go through Vercel AI SDK (@ai-sdk/*)
- Error handling must be graceful - continue with remaining models if 1-2 fail
- Use Promise.allSettled() for parallel Council queries
- Maintain separation between production code (src/) and evaluation code (src/eval/)

## Implementation Guidelines
- Follow the 7 phases in PLAN.md sequentially
- Each phase must be verified before moving to the next
- Mark completed tasks in PLAN.md with checkboxes
- Document any extra steps taken beyond the plan
- Keep MVP scope tight - no feature creep

## Testing Requirements
- Every provider wrapper must be individually testable
- Council must handle partial failures gracefully
- Consensus module must produce structured ConsensusResult
- Phase 7 evaluation must compare Council vs individual models

## Security & API Keys
- NEVER commit API keys to git
- Always use .env for sensitive config
- Validate all 5 API keys are present before running Council
- Handle API rate limits and timeouts (30s per provider)

## CLI UX Expectations
- Show real-time progress as each model responds
- Use ora spinners for visual feedback
- Pretty-print responses with markdown support
- Display timing information
- Handle Ctrl+C gracefully

## Before Committing
- Run TypeScript compiler to check for type errors
- Verify provider connectivity with --test-providers flag
- Test error handling scenarios (missing API keys, network failures)
- Update PLAN.md task checkboxes
